text: Dr. Antonín Benjamin Svojsík (September 5, 1876–September 17, 1938) was the founder of the Czechoslovak Scouting organization Junák. Dr. Svojsík served on the World Scout Committee of the World Organization of the Scout Movement from its creation in 1922 until 1933. When J. S. Wilson visited Czechoslovakia for two weeks in April and May 1947, he laid a wreath on the tomb of Dr. Svojsík. ==References== * Scouting Round the World, John S. Wilson, first edition, Blandford Press 1959 p. 46 88 162 Category:1876 births Category:1938 deaths Category:People from Prague Category:People from the Kingdom of Bohemia Category:World Scout Committee members Category:Scouting pioneers Category:Scouting and Guiding in the Czech Republic
title: Antonín Benjamin Svojsík
